metadata.Title: CVE-2018-19624 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
In Wireshark 2.6.0 to 2.6.4 and 2.4.0 to 2.4.10, the PVFS dissector could crash. This was addressed in epan/dissectors/packet-pvfs2.c by preventing a NULL pointer dereference.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-19624` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.0
libwireshark11 - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.0
libwiretap8 - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.0
libwscodecs2 - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.0
libwsutil9 - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.0
tshark - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.0
wireshark - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.0
wireshark-common - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.0
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.0
wireshark-qt - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.0
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.0').
